name: ITP015 - High Early Strength Lean Concrete Placement
template name: FH-ZU2-QU-ITP015 - High Early Strength Lean Concrete Placement - Rev 0

name: Acceptance Criteria - Current revision of drawings, technical specifications, permits as required for excavation and any other construction documentation is being utilised by Fulton Hogan and subcontractors.
○ Current revisions of these documents to be obtained via Aconex or ACC.
Reference Documents - Current Revisions in Aconex, ACC
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WMS
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS, WMS
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Site Supervisor

Acceptance Criteria - Plant and equipment items used in the Works shall be appropriate for the intended purpose and shall be maintained in good and serviceable condition at all times during which they are operating.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Site Supervisor
Acceptance Criteria - Theoretical mix design and preliminary trial mix results to be submitted to the Principal’s Representative for review and acceptance prior to full trial mixing.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed / test reports
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative
Acceptance Criteria - The theoretical mix design and preliminary trial mix results to be submitted not less than seven (7) working days prior to full trial mixing.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed / test reports
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative

Acceptance Criteria - Mixer uniformity tests shall be undertaken on the fully operational mixing plant at least seven (7) days prior to undertaking production trial and submitted to the Principal’s Representative.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative
Acceptance Criteria - A production trial must be completed as per the requirements in the specification.
○ The results and control procedures to be presented for review and approval by the Principal’s Representative.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative
Acceptance Criteria - Provide evidence to Principal’s Representative of concrete supplier demonstrating compliance to AS 1379 or is a third party accredited to AS 1379.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed / evidence documents
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative
Acceptance Criteria - The surface must be clean and inspected by the Principal’s Representative prior to placing.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative
Acceptance Criteria - HESLC shall not be placed when the shade temperature is below 5°C or above 35°C.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Site Supervisor
Acceptance Criteria - Compaction of HESLC shall commence immediately after placing and shall be by internal vibration.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Record of conformity - NATA Test Certificate
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Laboratory Technician
Record of conformity - NATA Test Certificate
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Laboratory Technician
Frequency - 6 cylinders per Lot (same cylinders used for compressive strength)
Acceptance Criteria - Results for information only. To be used to determine density of cores.
Record of conformity - NATA Test Certificate
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Laboratory Technician
Frequency - 4 cylinders per Lot (same cylinders used for Density)
Acceptance Criteria - Mean of the 4 cylinders to be minimum 10MPa and maximum 15MPa.
Record of conformity - NATA Test Certificate
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative
Frequency - 2 cylinders per Lot (same cylinders used for Density)
Acceptance Criteria - Each sample to be minimum 20MPa.
Record of conformity - NATA Test Certificate
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative
Acceptance Criteria - At the end of the day’s works, the HESLC to be feathered out and cut back before work restarts to give a straight, vertical face for full depth of layer.
○ Edges of construction joints shall be painted or sprayed with bituminous emulsion.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - HESLC to be sawcut into maximum slab spacing of 5m x 5m. Where pavement width is less than 5m the spacing shall be reduced to obtain slab dimension ratio of maximum 1:1.25.
○ Sawcut to be approximately one third of the layer depth.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - Finished surface of the HESLC to be picked up by a surveyor to determine the thickness of the layer.
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative
Frequency - Refer to markup in notes section
Acceptance Criteria - Cores shall be 120mm diameter.
○ Calculate the field density by comparing the density of individual cores with the average density of four (4) compressive strength cylinders taken.
○ Field density to be not less than 98%. If the density is less than 98% then a Hold Point to be raised for the nonconforming Lot.
Record of conformity - NATA Test Certificate
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative
Acceptance Criteria - Within three (3) weeks of completion of the Works, the Contractor shall supply two (2) copies of a report detailing the results of all quality control and testing undertaken.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative
Frequency - Prior to placing subsequent layer

Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor shall protect the HESLC from damage until surface layers are placed. The layer shall not be covered by any further pavement layers under it has been accepted by the Principal’s Representative.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative
5.7 - Removal and Replacement of Defective Pavement Areas
Acceptance Criteria - If required, defective pavement areas shall be removed and replaced as specified herein with pavements of thickness and quality required by the specifications.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan’s Quality \System Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.

1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WMS
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS, WMS
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Site Supervisor
Acceptance Criteria - All plant and equipment to be used in the constructed of the works must be deemed acceptable to use by the Principal’s Representative.
Reference Documents - Huesker HaTelit C Specifications 1.4.1
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Site Supervisor, Principal’s Representative
Frequency - Prior to commencing works, not less than 10 days prior to commencement of delivery
Acceptance Criteria - Proposed tack coat material and test certificates shall be submitted to the Principal’s Representative for review.
Reference Documents - Huesker HaTelit C Specifications 1.10.1
Record of conformity - Aconex Corresponde nce
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative
Frequency - Prior to commencing works, not less than 20 days prior to scheduled commencement of application
Acceptance Criteria - Information on proposed HaTelit C manufacturer and test certificates to be submitted to the Principal’s Representative.
Reference Documents - Huesker HaTelit C Specifications 1.10.2
Record of conformity - Aconex Corresponde nce
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative
Acceptance Criteria - All loose and foreign materials must be removed from the surfaces to a distance not less than 150 mm beyond the edge of the area to be tack-coated
○ All treatments within area to be tack coated to be inspected by the Principal’s Representative.
Reference Documents - Huesker HaTelit C Specifications 1.6.1
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative
Acceptance Criteria - The tack coat shall be sprayed evenly at the required spray rate of 0.4 - 0.55 L/m2 to achieve target residual bitumen as per guide.
○ Rate may be adjusted based on site-specific conditions ensuring HaTelit C is bonded to underlying surface.
Reference Documents - Huesker HaTelit C Specifications 1.6.2
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Site Supervisor
Acceptance Criteria - A minimum of 48 hours’ notice shall be given to the Principal’s Representative prior to the commencement of placing the HaTelit.
Reference Documents - Huesker HaTelit C Specifications 1.7.3
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative

Acceptance Criteria - HaTelit to be installed to Manufacturers Specification. Where placing multiple rolls, an overlap of 250mm transversely and 150mm longitudinally is required. The overlaps shall be treated with tack coat and rolled to bond to one another. For small areas, manual installation is acceptable provided a fully flat and crease free installation is achieved.
Reference Documents - Huesker HaTelit C Specifications 1.7.2
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative
Acceptance Criteria - Rolls applied to tack coated surface without wrinkles, creases and folds. HaTelit to be rolled with 2 passes using pneumatic tyred rollers following application.
Reference Documents - Huesker HaTelit C Specifications 1.7.3
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Site Supervisor
Acceptance Criteria - Installed HaTelit surface to be inspected and areas recorded where required for flatness and saturation.
○ Surface to be free from any loose or deleterious material.
Reference Documents - Huesker HaTelit C Specifications 1.7.3
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative
Acceptance Criteria - Test locations to show adequate bond between HaTelit and tack coated surface.
Reference Documents - Huesker HaTelit C Specifications 1.7.4
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative

Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that the surface of the installed HaTelit and the underlying asphalt layer is dry, clean, undamaged and free from loose material until the completion of paving over the installed HaTelit.
Reference Documents - Huesker HaTelit C Specifications 1.7.5
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Site Supervisor
Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor shall assess the conformance of the surface flatness and saturation of the installed HaTelit surface
Reference Documents - Huesker HaTelit C Specifications 1.12.1
Inspection/Test Method - Survey Report & Visual Inspection
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative

Acceptance Criteria - If required, any sections deemed nonconforming shall be removed and replaced according to Manufacturer’s Specifications - FH NCR Procedure to be adopted when lot area is deemed nonconforming.
Reference Documents - Huesker HaTelit C Specifications 1.13.1
Record of conformity - Nonconform ance Report
Responsibility - Project / Site Engineer, Principal’s Representative

Frequency - Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are using the latest and complete set of drawings
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Frequency - Prior to commencing any activities
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP.
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
Record of conformity - Site and office Inspection
Acceptance Criteria - All materials shall be proven to meet contractual requirements prior to acceptance.
– MAGS shall be from ATG Airfield guidance signs range
– from the ADB Safegate range only
– Runway guard lights shall be from ADB Safegate only.
– Intermediate hold position lights shall be from the ADB Safegate range only
– Stop Bar Lights shall be from the ADB Safegate
○ Any deviation from the above suppliers shall be submitted to the Contract Administrator for approval prior to ordering.

○ The Contractor shall survey the proposed light locations in conjunction with the new and existing line-marking to set out the proposed lights. A schedule of the proposed lights shall be produced and submitted to the Contract Administrator.
Acceptance Criteria - Components of elevated lights shall:
– Be less than 360mm above the pavement level including the frangible coupling.
– Be suitable for installation on a threaded connection when installed.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Components of inset lights shall:
– Be less than 13mm height above the surrounding surface.
– Have a slope of surface of the unit to be less than 20 degrees (not including any recesses).
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, ADBSG Installation of Inset Light Fittings checklist
Acceptance Criteria - SITs shall be installed in specified deep base cans or pits
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, ADBSG Installation of Series Isolating Transformer (SIT)
Acceptance Criteria - Each luminaire fitting shall be installed on the appropriate circuit as specified in the AGL schedule.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, As-Built Documentation
Acceptance Criteria - Submission of surveyed luminaire position to superintendent prior to practical completion
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
